summary: This document is a set of 30-minute check sheets for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 10, 2019. The sheets are for monitoring inmates in continuous lockdown status, requiring staff to observe and document checks at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule. The document is significant as it represents the standard operating procedure for inmate observation at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Daily Inmate Observation Logs
events.description: Routine 30-minute check sheets were completed for inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York, documenting staff observations throughout the day and night.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a prison log sheet from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York's Special Housing Unit (SHU) dated August 10, 2019.
It outlines the procedure for observing inmates in continuous lockdown status (e.g., administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The checks are to be documented in 30-minute intervals across three watches: Morning, Day, and Evening, each overseen by a Lieutenant.
The log sheets are reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.
This type of document represents the standard inmate monitoring protocol at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated.
